attributes.action: intervene with the unnecessary ammount of spending of public money on the 2012 olympics.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Culture Secretary Tessa Jowell has clearly lost control of the spending on the 2012 Olympics.  Based on the current budget UK Businesses are going to see virtually no increase in revenue as a result.

Therefore we ask Prime Minister Blair to intervene with this loss of control / spending to stop this spending spiralling further out of control.  

The revised budget of £10bn equates to the population of the UK (whether 8months old or 80 years) paying £83 each.

Surely this revised budget could be better spent on the NHS / Public Transport infrastructure/ Education.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
